Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the number of bipartisan bills passed by the House by including bills with as few as one Republican vote.
Lack enough support: Many of the bills mentioned in the claim did not receive significant bipartisan support, with some receiving only one or a few Republican votes.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that all the bills mentioned are currently sitting on the desk of Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell, without providing evidence for this assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: There could be alternative explanations for why these bills have not been taken up by the Senate, such as differing priorities or disagreements on the content of the bills.
